meanings.sent1: The mechanic's hands were oilier after working on the car engine.
meanings.sent2: The pizza from that restaurant is always oilier than the one from the other place.
meanings.sent3: The oilier the salad dressing, the more slippery the salad becomes!
meanings.sent4: Her hair glistened in the sun, looking even oilier than usual.
meanings.sent5: The old frying pan was so oilier that it left a shiny residue on everything it touched.

meanings.definition: Having a greasy or slick texture.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic's overalls felt oilier than a wet sponge.
meanings.sent2: The rain made the roads even oilier, causing cars to skid.
meanings.sent3: The oilier the floor, the more likely someone will slip and fall!
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt oilier than usual after forgetting to wash her face.
meanings.sent5: The oilier the surface, the harder it is to get a good grip.

meanings.sent1: The oilier fields in that region are known for their rich resources.
meanings.sent2: The oilier rocks tend to have a distinct smell when crushed.
meanings.sent3: The oilier the well, the more valuable it is to the company.
meanings.sent4: The oilier the engine, the smoother it runs.
meanings.sent5: The oilier the ground, the more likely you'll find hidden pockets of oil.
